solution_line_template: If the store ordered {num_boxes} boxes, each having {pencils_per_box} pencils, they ordered {num_boxes}*{pencils_per_box} = <<{num_boxes}*{pencils_per_box}={num_pencils}>>{num_pencils} pencils.
If the cost of a pencil was ${cost_per_pencil}, the store paid ${cost_per_pencil}*{num_pencils} = $<<{cost_per_pencil}*{num_pencils}={total_pencil_cost}>>{total_pencil_cost} for all the pencils.
Twice as many pens as pencils that the store ordered are {pens_multiplier}*{num_pencils}= <<{pens_multiplier}*{num_pencils}={twice_pencils}>>{twice_pencils}
If A store ordered {pens_extra} more than twice as many pens as it did pencils, it ordered {twice_pencils}+{pens_extra}= <<{twice_pencils}+{pens_extra}={num_pens}>>{num_pens} pencils.
Since the cost of the pens was ${cost_per_pen}, the store paid {num_pens}*${cost_per_pen} = $<<{num_pens}*{cost_per_pen}={total_pen_cost}>>{total_pen_cost} for the pens.
The total amount of money they paid for the stationery is {total_pen_cost}+{total_pencil_cost} = $<<{total_pen_cost}+{total_pencil_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}
